myphd 0.0.1
  • myphd
  • Reference

    Basic pre-processing of datasets

    preproc_data.Rd

    This function performs basic pre-processing of a given dataset:

    • Data cleaning:

      • Removal of incorrect/unwanted variables.

      • Remove of incorrect/unwanted subjects.

      • Handling of missing values.

    • Variable transformations:

      • Transformation (e.g., log-transformation, bound outcome).

      • Standardization (zero mean and unit standard deviation).

      • Normalization (subtract the minimum and divide by the range).

    preproc_data(
  dat,
  covariates,
  outcome,
  creatinine_var_names,
  creatinine_covariates_names,
  creatinine_name,
  dic_steps,
  id_var,
  by_var
)

    Arguments

    dat

    A dataframe containing the variables of interest. A tibble.

    covariates

    A dataframe containing additional variables. A tibble.

    outcome

    A string indicating the outcome variable. A string.

    dic_steps

    A nested named list of steps to perform. A list. It can include the following elements:

    • llod, to handle values <LOD/LOQ. A named list with elements:

    • method, the method to be used. A string.

    • missings, to handle missing values. A named list with elements:

    • threshold_within, the missing value threshold within each group. An integer.

    • threshold_overall, the overall missing value threshold. An integer.

    • creatinine, to handle confounding by dilution. A named list with elements:

    • method_args, options for fitting the models. A list.

    • standardization, to standardize variables. A named list with elements:

    • center_fun, the centering function (e.g., median).

    • scale_fun, the scaling function (e.g., IQR).

    • bound, to bound the outcome variable. A named list with elements:

    id_var

    The variable name to be used to identify subjects. A string.

    by_var

    The variable name to group by. A string.

    Value

    A pre-processed dataset. A tibble.

    Contents
